title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 16
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: The wind still continuing to blow fresh from the N.W., at five p.m. thewriter caused a signal to be made from the tender for the _Smeaton_ and_Patriot_ to slip their moorings, when they ran for Lunan Bay, ananchorage on the east side of the Redhead.

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 16
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: The wind still continuing to blow fresh from the N.W., at five p.m. thewriter caused a signal to be made from the tender for the _Smeaton_ and_Patriot_ to slip their moorings, when they ran for Lunan Bay, ananchorage on the east side of the Redhead.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Leaving Forfar by the Arbroath and Forfar line, and proceeding eastward,  on the left are seen in the distance the hills of Carse, and in the vicinity of the line the village of Lunanhead, deriving its name from a spring which rises here, and wending its way eastward, flows into the sea at Lunan Bay.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Lunan Bay, a fine bay on the coast ofScotland, Forfarshire, at the mouth of theriver Lunan.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Though as accomphshed aknight as ever rode to battle, the earl was somewhat ofa seaman, for his father's castle in Forfarshhe lookeddown on Lunan Bay.
